Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates Nigeria's suicide rate by stating that it is the highest in Africa, when in fact it is the seventh highest.
Understate: The claim understates Nigeria's suicide rate by ranking it 15th in the world, when it is actually the 15th highest.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing enough support for the ranking and statistics mentioned.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide detailed information or sources for the suicide rate rankings.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that Nigeria has the highest suicide rate in Africa without considering other countries like Lesotho which actually have higher rates.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim as it is mentioned that Nigeria's suicide rate is based on estimated mortality rates and not high-quality data.
